page.title: 01General Introduction
page.content: Britwell Salome and the adjoining village of Upperton and Brihtwell Baldwin orm quiet, friendly rural communities. The nearest towns are Watlington and Wallinford. The population of all three villaes is small and consists of families and eldely people. Several people have lived there for many years. The area consists of arm-land, farm buidings and houses. Britwell and Brihtwell Baldwin both have a parish church, and a public house. Brightwell Baldwin also has a little shop which contains a post office. The old school in Brightwell Baldwin is now a private house. Children in all the villages come by coach to school in Watlington.
